title.rendered: Find Rooms For Rent In Tulsa

content.rendered:
A flavorful blend of art and culture represents the ‘heart of Oklahoma.’ Tulsa is the second-largest city in Oklahoma, famous for its dynamic urban civilization. Be it a calming walk in the park or a craving for some good ol’ opera, this city caters to every mood! You can feel influences from South, Southwest, Mid-West and Native American cultures throughout the city. You’ll experience this especially in the wildlife reserves and ethnic festivals that represent the city. So, if you’re looking for rooms for rent in Tulsa, use this guide to see where the best things are.

Getting to know Tulsa

Let us guide you on finding cheap rooms for rent in Tulsa. But before that, we’ll take you on a tour of the culture and history of the city.

What was Tulsa originally called? ‘Tallasi,’ which means ‘old town,’ was the name given to the city by Creek Council Oak Tree back in the 19th Century.

During your time here, you’ll experience all four seasons. Not only does Tulsa promise hot and humid summers, but also, cold to mild winters. Because it’s situated between the Great Plains and the rolling hills of the Ozarks, Tulsa holds the “Green Country” title. That means the city is full of the greenest vegetation in Oklahoma. Also, Tulsa is the most topographically diverse city in the entire state! So, if you’re a nature lover, there’s much to explore in Tulsa’s 135 parks.

Find rooms for rent in Tulsa

Find A Room For Rent In Tulsa

Explore neighborhoods and pick the vibe of the life of your dreams. Downtown, Midtown, Southern, and Western regions bring a diverse taste to the city. And with Roomi, you can browse the best rooms for rent in Tulsa.

Downtown is the financial and business hub of the district; home to the Tulsa Performing Arts Centre amongst many others. Whereas, Midtown is the historical core of Tulsa, having been built in the early 20th century. Here, you can soak in architecture from the Greek Revival & Art Deco movements! All you have to do is take a stroll through The Swan Lake Neighborhood or Cherry Street.

With our help, you get an idea about the average rent in Tulsa. This makes it easy for you to check out the areas for affordable housing. The Southern region was developed post-1970s and they opted for low-density accommodations with massive retail development. Also, it’s home to one of the biggest shopping malls in the State, ‘Woodland Hills Mall.’ Now can you say “retail therapy?”

The Arkansas River divides other regions from West Tulsa. Here, you’ll find the USA’s 3rd largest municipal park, ‘Mohawk Park.’

Looking to live with roommates? Learn the 10 Important Factors for an Ideal Roommate.

Top neighborhoods in Tulsa

Looking for cheap rooms for rent in Tulsa can be a tedious task. But that’s where we come to save the day! Check out the list below and get an idea about some of the best neighborhoods in the city.

  • Turner Park: About 6 miles from Downtown, you will find yourself in the charming neighborhood of Turner Park. Its serene single-story apartments were built in a post-war architectural style. Also, if you’re looking for a short commute, Turner Park will be the perfect location. Definitely start your search for rooms for rent in Tulsa here.
  • Gilcrease Hills: A beautifully planned community, Gilcrease Hills is located on the Northeastern side of Tulsa. If you wish to balance between the suburbs and the city, this would be ideal. That’s because it is situated very close to the city center.
  • Sand Springs: Sand Springs has all the perks of a small town, but is just a few miles away from dynamic city life. Sand Springs has a mix of old and new architecture, situated on the Western side of Tulsa.

Average rent in Tulsa

Find the average rents throughout the United States in this report by us here.

University life in Tulsa

No commute to Tulsa’s many universities is too long with the city’s spread-out bus routes. But with us, you can search for ideal rooms for rent in Tulsa as per your college locality!

Here are some of the universities in Tulsa:

  1. University of Tulsa
  2. Oral Roberts University
  3. Tulsa Community College
  4. Spartan College of Aeronautics and Technology

How transit-friendly is Tulsa?

Transportation should be one of the main criteria to judge when finding rooms for rent in Tulsa as a budget-conscious person.

1. Cycling

Cycling is immensely supported with protected bike lanes and bike maps for the city! Exploring Tulsa as you cycle is therapeutic, especially for those of you who prefer keeping an eye on your health.

2. Walkability

Tulsa ranked 34th out of 141 U.S. cities for being the most ‘walkable.’ So, we hope you keep your sneakers handy!

3. Public Transportation

Tulsa Bus Transit consists of 97 vehicles running across 19 different routes connecting all four; Downtown, Midtown, Southern and Western Tulsa.

4. Airport

The international Airport in Tulsa is responsible for over 80 departures a day!

5. River Port

Port of Catoosa is an inland port that helps connect the Mississippi River with the Arkansas River,. Actually, it’s become one of the largest river ports in the U.S.!

Restaurants in Tulsa

Let’s talk about food baby! Nationally known for delivering premium BBQ experiences, Tulsa is home to the ‘Hasty-Bake Company.’ Two Tulsa originals have even expanded beyond the United States’ vicinity; Rib Crib and Billy Sims Barbecue. Hickory-smoked baloney anyone? Check them out here:

  1. Rib Crib
  2. Billy Sims
  3. Hasty-Bake

Cultural Activities in Tulsa

Tulsa has many attractions but culture, art, and nature trump it all! Here is a list for you:

  1. The Philbrook Museum of Art
  2. Tulsa Performing Arts Center
  3. Gilcrease Museum
  4. Tulsa Zoo
  5. Tulsa Garden Center

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find rooms for rent in Tulsa? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!
